framework_description: Comprehensive Bluebook/Redbook error detection framework consolidating all analysis from Rules 1-16 and Tables 1-16
sources: Rules 1-4: Structure, Signals, Subdivisions, Short Forms

phase_1.name: Regex Pre-Screening
phase_1.description: Fast pattern matching for obvious errors

error_catalog.description: Citation sentence must end with a period
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Add period at end of citation sentence
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check if this citation is a complete citation sentence (supports an entire sentence). If yes, verify it: 1) Starts with capital letter, 2) Ends with period, 3) Not embedded within another sentence. Citation: {citation_text}. Return: VALID or ERROR with explanation

error_catalog.description: 'Id' must always include period
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check 'Id.' formatting: 1) Capital 'I', lowercase 'd', 2) Always followed by period, 3) Italicized, 4) If pincite follows, use 'at' before page number. Text: {id_citation}. Return: CORRECT or list specific errors

error_catalog.description: Redbook requires 'at' after Id. when citing different page
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Insert 'at' between Id. and page number
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Redbook Rule 4.2: Always include 'at' after Id. when citing to a different page. Format: Same page: Id. | Different page: Id. at 123. | Footnote: Id. at 123 n.4. Citation: {id_citation}. Return: CORRECT or ERROR with proper format

error_catalog.description: Introductory signals must be italicized
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check if introductory signals are properly formatted: 1) Signals must be italicized (except when used as verbs in textual sentences), 2) Proper capitalization (only first word of citation sentence), 3) Correct punctuation after signal. Text: {citation_text}. Return: FORMATTING_CORRECT or list of issues

error_catalog.description: 'Cf.' and 'But cf.' signals REQUIRE explanatory parentheticals
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Rule: 'Cf.' and 'But cf.' signals MUST include explanatory parentheticals. 'See generally' signals must NOT include explanatory parentheticals. Check this citation: {citation_text}. Return: Signal type identified, Parenthetical presence (YES/NO), COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT with reason

examples.correct: Cf. Smith v. Jones, 123 U.S. 456 (2000) (holding similar standard in contract context).

error_catalog.description: 'See generally' must NOT have explanatory parenthetical
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check: 'See generally' signals must NOT have explanatory parentheticals per Redbook 1.12. Citation: {citation_text}. Return: COMPLIANT or NON_COMPLIANT with specific issue

examples.incorrect: See generally Smith v. Jones, 123 U.S. 456 (2000) (discussing constitutional law).
examples.correct: See generally Smith v. Jones, 123 U.S. 456 (2000).

error_catalog.description: Signals must appear in Bluebook order
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Reorder signals: No signal → E.g. → Accord → See → See also → Cf. → Compare...with → But see → But cf. → See generally
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check if signals appear in correct Bluebook order: 1. No signal → 2. E.g. → 3. Accord → 4. See → 5. See also → 6. Cf. → 7. Compare...with → 8. But see → 9. But cf. → 10. See generally. Citation string: {full_citation_sentence}. Return: Signals found (in order of appearance), Expected order, CORRECT or OUT_OF_ORDER with correction

examples.incorrect: See also Smith, 100 U.S. 1 (1990); see Jones, 200 U.S. 2 (2000).
examples.correct: See Jones, 200 U.S. 2 (2000); see also Smith, 100 U.S. 1 (1990).

error_catalog.description: Explanatory parenthetical must start with lowercase (unless proper noun)
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Change first letter to lowercase unless proper noun
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check explanatory parenthetical formatting: 1) Must start with lowercase letter (unless proper noun), 2) Should begin with present participle or quoted sentence, 3) Cannot start with article (a, an, the). Parenthetical: {parenthetical_text}. Return: First word, Type (present participle/quote/other), CORRECT or ERROR with issue

examples.incorrect: Smith v. Jones, 100 U.S. 1 (2000) (The court held that...).

error_catalog.description: Never use 'supra' for cases
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Use short case name instead: Smith, 100 U.S. at 123
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Bluebook Rule: Do NOT use 'supra' for cases. Use short case name instead. Incorrect: Smith v. Jones, supra note 10. Correct: Smith, 100 U.S. at 123 (if within 5 footnotes) or Smith v. Jones, 100 U.S. 1, 123 (1990) (if beyond 5 footnotes). Citation: {citation_text}. Type: {authority_type}. Return: SUPRA_APPROPRIATE or USE_SHORT_FORM with correct format

examples.incorrect: Smith v. Jones, supra note 10, at 123.

error_catalog.description: Use § symbol in citations, not word 'section'
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: In statutory citations, must use § symbol, not word 'section'. Citation: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR with correction

error_catalog.description: Space required after section symbol
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check section symbol spacing: must have space between § and the section number. Citation: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

error_catalog.description: Use single § for single section, not §§
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check section symbol usage: Single section: § 102, Multiple consecutive: §§ 102-105, Multiple non-consecutive: §§ 102, 105, 108. Citation: {section_citation}. Return: CORRECT or ERROR with proper format

error_catalog.description: Never include year for constitutional citations
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Constitutional citations: Never include year. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

error_catalog.description: Use Roman numerals for constitutional articles and amendments
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check constitutional citation format: 1) Correct abbreviation (U.S. Const. or state abbreviation), 2) Proper use of article/amendment abbreviations, 3) Roman numerals for articles and amendments, 4) No date included, 5) Proper section notation if applicable, 6) Correct comma placement. Citation: {citation}. Return: Is Valid (Yes/No), Errors Found, Corrected Citation, Rule Citation

error_catalog.description: State codes always require year and publisher
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Add publisher and year in parentheses
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: State code citations must include publisher and year. Example: Cal. Civ. Code § 1714 (West 2020). Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR with missing elements

error_catalog.description: U.S.C. must have periods
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Correct to U.S.C. with periods and no extra spaces
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check U.S.C. abbreviation: must be 'U.S.C.' with periods, no extra spaces. Citation: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

error_catalog.description: Case names must be italicized
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Check typeface formatting for this citation: 1) Case names must be italicized (including 'v.'), 2) Reporter names are roman, 3) Dates/parentheticals are roman. Citation: {citation_text}. Return: List of formatting issues or CORRECT

error_catalog.description: Book titles must be italicized
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Book titles must be italicized, not in quotation marks. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

examples.incorrect: John Doe, The Death of Contract (2020)
examples.correct: John Doe, The Death of Contract (2020)

error_catalog.description: Use 'et al.' for three or more authors
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Use first author followed by 'et al.'
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: For three or more authors, use first author followed by 'et al.'. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR with correction

examples.incorrect: John Smith, Jane Doe, & Robert Jones, Article, 100 Yale L.J. 1 (2020)
examples.correct: John Smith et al., Article, 100 Yale L.J. 1 (2020)

error_catalog.description: Use '2d' and '3d', not '2nd' or '3rd'
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Reporter series must use '2d' and '3d', not '2nd' or '3rd'. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR with correction

error_catalog.description: Space required after 'F.' in F. Supp.
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: F. Supp. requires space after F. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

error_catalog.description: Treaty names must NOT be italicized
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Treaty names should NOT be italicized (unlike case names). Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

examples.incorrect: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties, May 23, 1969, 1155 U.N.T.S. 331
examples.correct: Vienna Convention on the Law of Treaties, May 23, 1969, 1155 U.N.T.S. 331

error_catalog.description: U.N.T.S. must have periods after each component
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: International abbreviations require periods. UNTS must be U.N.T.S. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

error_catalog.description: Never use postal codes (CA, NY) in legal citations
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Replace postal code with proper legal abbreviation
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: NEVER use postal codes (CA, NY, TX) in legal citations. Use proper abbreviations (Cal., N.Y., Tex.). Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR with correction

error_catalog.description: Two authors must be joined with ampersand (&)
error_catalog.fix_pattern: Replace comma with ampersand between two authors
error_catalog.gpt_validation_prompt: Two authors must be joined with '&'. Check: {citation}. Return: VALID or ERROR

examples.incorrect: John Smith, Jane Doe, Article Title
examples.correct: John Smith & Jane Doe, Article Title

critical.description: Errors that fundamentally misidentify or misrepresent authority

regex_patterns.accuracy: High precision, low to medium recall

workflow: 2. GPT analyzes flagged items in context
3. Confidence scoring determines auto-fix vs. human review
4. Learning loop improves both regex and prompts

redbook_specific_rules.description: Stanford Law Review deviations from standard Bluebook

key_differences.deviation: Always place footnote call at end of sentence
Always use 'at' with Id. for different page
Cf./But cf. require parenthetical; See generally forbids it
Include both remands in case history
